comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I think it was a Thursday in April  . . .

. . . and the photographer was round and cold . . .

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Well done to Debbie over on the blog for the id and date - archivesoutside.records.nsw.gov.au/can-you-date-this-phot... Date: Thursday 12 April 1906, Photographer - Ralph Snowball The original (large size shows amazing detail) - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/3307691868/] The train arrives - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/3307691990/] After the train goes - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/4045206614/] For the triptych above Ralph Snowball was up a distant signal post seen in this reverse view - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/4045207560/] And a view of the level crossing and footbridge - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/4044463833/] It is bugging me that I cannot find a station clock to get the exact time on 12/4/1906. I think it is about 11 am, from the shadows of the verandahs, the NW-SE orientation of the railway line, and the April time of year. Opinions anyone?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes, well done to everyone! It was way too easy for you all! Have to dig deep for the next challenge, me thinks...

AB
